intro: Verbascum × pelitnopilodes, commonly known as the hybrid mullein, is a perennial plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its large, velvety, gray-green leaves that are covered in dense hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. Verbascum × pelitnopilodes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its ability to attract pollinators.
